definitions.title: fish
definitions.body: (NH id.)—[[דָּג]]Jon 1:17, Jon 1:17, Jon 2:10 + Ne 13:16 Qr (Kt [[דָּאג]]); [[דָּגִים]] 1Ki 5:13 + 6 t.; [[דְּגֵי]] Ge 9:2 + 7 t.;—fish of sea Jon 2:1, Jon 1:17, Jon 2:10 (in v:Jon 1:17 [[גׇּדוֹל]] ´[[ד]]); Ne 13:16 ([[דָּאג]] Kt [[דָּג]] article of Tyrian trade; only here coll., rd. perh. [[דָּגׇה]]; or regard as late usage, cf. converse [[דָּגׇה]] of individual Jon 2:2);—elsewhere always pl.: as subj. of Solomon's utterance 1Ki 5:13; fish-spear [[חִלְחַל דגים]] Job 40:31; most often [[דְּגֵי הַיׇּם]]Ge 9:2 (P), Ps 8:9, Ho 4:3, Zep 1:3, Ez Eze 38:20, Job 12:8 (in all opp. to beasts & birds, & appar. used with them, + [[רֶמֶשׂ]] Ez. cf. vb. [[רמשׂ]] Gn, for animal creation in general; also Hb Hab 1:14 cf. infr.); Nu 11:22 (JE) of fish (with beasts) as food (cf. Ge 9:2 f.) in simile of men ensnared, like fish taken in net ([[מְחוֹדָה]]) Ec 9:12 cf. Hb Hab 1:14 ([[דְּגֵי הַיׇּם]]); 4 t. [[שַׁעַר הַדָּגִים]] fish-gate 2Ch 33:14, Zep 1:10, Ne 3:3, Ne 12:39 (on situation cf. [[שַׁעַר]]).
